org.fhnw.aigs.Minesweeper.client

Class MinesweeperPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • org.fhnw.aigs.Minesweeper.client.MinesweeperPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class MinesweeperPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    The graphical representation of a Minesweeper field
    Version:
    1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli (v1.0)

    • Field Detail

      • imageView

        private javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView
        Provides a graphic. It can be a mine count number, a mine or a flag.

      • height

        private double height
        The field height.

      • width

        private double width
        The field width.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinesweeperPane

        public MinesweeperPane()
        Creates a new instance of MinesweeperPane and styles it.

    • Method Detail

      • setFlag

        public void setFlag()
        Sets a flag (marks mine).

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage()
        Remove the image, e.g. the flag.

      • cover

        void cover()
        Changes the style of the field so that it appears to be covered again. This will be used if you restart the game.

      • uncover

        public void uncover(MinesweeperField field)
        Uncover the field. This changes the style of the image and shows the number of surrounding mines or the mine if there is one.
        Parameters:
        field - The logical reprsentation of that field.

      • addStyle

        public void addStyle(MinesweeperPane pane,
                     java.lang.String styleName)
        Adds a new style in JavaFX by invoking.
        This method is needed because the program will crash if an existing part of a window element is changed without invoking.
        Parameters:
        pane - the reference to the pane. Most time 'this'
        styleName - The new style name
        Since:
        Version 1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli)

      • clearStyle

        public void clearStyle(MinesweeperPane pane)
        Removes all styles in JavaFX by invoking.
        This method is needed because the program will crash if an existing part of a window element is changed without invoking.
        Parameters:
        pane - the reference to the pane. Most time 'this'
        Since:
        Version 1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli)

      • setImage

        public void setImage(javafx.scene.image.ImageView imageView,
                     javafx.scene.image.Image image)
        Draws the new image in JavaFX by invoking.
        This method is needed because the program will crash if an existing part of a window element is changed without invoking.
        Parameters:
        imageView - The ImageView object (field on board) to change
        image - The new image object
        Since:
        Version 1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli)
